main event: A police officer in Lancaster, PA reported sighting an unidentified flying object about the size of three stars and orange in color, approximately 30 degrees above the horizon.
interesting points: The UFO hovered for around 45 minutes before flying out of sight to the west.
The weather at the time was clear with good visibility.
The report was filed on February 23, 1952 and sent to various military and intelligence agencies.
The report mentions both Mars and Venus being visible in the west at the time, but states the color was more closely associated with Mars.
The report concludes that there was 'insufficient data for evaluation' regarding the sighting.
sighted object: an orange, reddish-colored object estimated to be 3 times the size of a star
